RESOLVED_ENTITIES.Supreme Court: Supreme Court of the United States

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States: country with lawful bounds for stops, governing principles for traffic stops and arrests
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Supreme Court of the United States: high court that has long held certain principles regarding reasonableness in traffic stops and arrests
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Court: governing body for traffic stops and arrests, applying principles set out in Terry
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Judge: judge to review the motion independently, ensuring adherence to lawful standards for traffic stops and arrests
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Magistrate Judge: judge making recommendations based on the reasonableness of the stop under the totality of the circumstances
